title: pad_tokenize
description: Tokenize and pad a batch of data for scGPT integration zero-shot inference or fine-tuning.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: The input h5mu file of pre-processed data.

modality.description: Which modality from the input MuData file to process.

var_gene_names.description: The name of the .var column containing gene names

var_input.description: The name of the adata.var column containing boolean mask for vocabulary-cross checked and/or highly variable genes.

input_obsm_binned_counts.description: The name of the .obsm field containing the binned counts to be padded and tokenized.

output.description: The output h5mu file containing obsm arrays for gene tokens, tokenized data and padding mask.
output.help_text: Type: `file`, multiple: `False`, required, default: `"$id.$key.output.h5mu"`, direction: `output`, example: `"output.h5mu"`.

obsm_gene_tokens.description: The key of the .obsm array containing the gene token ids

obsm_tokenized_values.description: The key of the .obsm array containing the count values of the tokenized genes

obsm_padding_mask.description: The key of the .obsm array containing the padding mask.

output_compression.description:
Compression format to use for the output AnnData and/or Mudata objects.
By default no compression is applied.

pad_value.description: The value of the padding token.

max_seq_len.description: The maximum sequence length of the tokenized data

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.
